bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 199 (Thursday, December 12, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CURTIS:H.R. 5409.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Sections 7 & 8 of Article I of the United StatesConstitution and Amendment XVI of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H10258]

item.title: Energy Storage Tax Incentive and Deployment Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: Energy Storage Tax Incentive and Deployment Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Incentivizing New and Valuable Energy Storage Technology (INVEST) Act of 2019

This bill provides for tax credits for energy storage technologies, including a residential energy efficient property credit for battery storage technology expenditures.

bill.title: Incentivizing New and Valuable Energy Storage Technology (INVEST) Act of 2019

item.title: Incentivizing New and Valuable Energy Storage Technology (INVEST) Act of 2019
To amend the Internal Revenue Code to provide tax credits for energy storage technology, and for other purposes.
Incentivizing New and Valuable Energy Storage Technology (INVEST) Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
